alert.note: Alert for Lebanon; Schuylkill (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 19 at 4:46AM EST until December 19 at 7:00PM EST by NWS State College
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Pennsylvania... Swatara Creek Near Hershey affecting Lebanon and Dauphin Counties. Swatara Creek At Harper Tavern affecting Lebanon and Schuylkill Counties. For the Swatara Creek...including Harper Tavern, Hershey...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Swatara Creek at Harper Tavern. * WHEN...Until this evening. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, A number of secondary roads are closed, resulting in some evacuations. A few homes are flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:15 AM EST Tuesday the stage was 11.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The creek crested at 12 feet around 4 AM EST and is falling. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this afternoon and continue falling to 3.5 feet early Friday morning. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon.
